dt: {bc}to get rid of especially as useless or unwanted
{bc}to remove (a playing card) from one's hand {dx_def}see {dxt|hand:1||7a(1)}{/dx_def}
{bc}to play (any card except a {d_link|trump|trump:1}) from a suit different from the one led

dt.t: {wi}discard{/wi} at the end of your turn

pt: {sc}discard{/sc} {sc}cast{/sc} {sc}shed{/sc} {sc}slough{/sc} {sc}scrap{/sc} {sc}junk{/sc} mean to get rid of. {sc}discard{/sc} implies the letting go or throwing away of something that has become useless or superfluous though often not intrinsically valueless.
{sc}cast{/sc}, especially when used with {it}off, away{/it}, or {it}out{/it}, implies a forceful rejection or repudiation.
{sc}shed{/sc} and {sc}slough{/sc} imply a throwing off of something both useless and encumbering and often suggest a consequent renewal of vitality or luster.
{sc}scrap{/sc} and {sc}junk{/sc} imply throwing away or breaking up as worthless in existent form.

shortdef: to get rid of especially as useless or unwanted
to remove (a playing card) from one's hand
to play (any card except a trump) from a suit different from the one led
